name: Anglerfish
description: They have perfected the art of deep-sea fishing. Although different species vary in size and shape, they all lure prey towards them with their fishing rod-like appendages. When unsuspecting prey swims too close, the anglerfish snaps it up.

name: Anglerfish
description: They have perfected the art of deep-sea fishing. Although different species vary in size and shape, they all lure prey towards them with their fishing rod-like appendages. When unsuspecting prey swims too close, the anglerfish snaps it up.

name: Bottlenose Dolphin
description: Bottlenose dolphins are counter-shaded: blackish, slate, gray, brown or bluish on top, and lighter on the sides; and whitish or paler pinkish gray underneath. Sometimes there are spots on the belly and a stripe between the eye and the flipper.

name: Bottlenose Dolphin
description: Bottlenose dolphins are counter-shaded: blackish, slate, gray, brown or bluish on top, and lighter on the sides; and whitish or paler pinkish gray underneath. Sometimes there are spots on the belly and a stripe between the eye and the flipper.

name: California Sea Lion
description: The California sea lion is a member of the “eared seal” family. This pinniped is adept at leaping out of the water. It’s often found sitting on top of rocks, floating docks and beams under fishing piers — even balancing on floating buoys.

name: California Sea Lion
description: The California sea lion is a member of the “eared seal” family. This pinniped is adept at leaping out of the water. It’s often found sitting on top of rocks, floating docks and beams under fishing piers — even balancing on floating buoys.

name: Dumbo Octopus
description: Dumbo Octopus serves as the collective common name of octopuses in the genus Grimpoteuthis. The name comes from the over-sized, ear-like fins protruding from the top of the head-like bodies. It's the deepest dwelling of all known octopus

name: Gray Whale
description: Named for the unique distinctive gray and white patterning. Their white patches are mostly made up of barnacles and lice that have attached themselves to the whale’s body they can carry over 400 pounds of barnacles and whale lice.

name: Gray Whale
description: Named for the unique distinctive gray and white patterning. Their white patches are mostly made up of barnacles and lice that have attached themselves to the whale’s body they can carry over 400 pounds of barnacles and whale lice.

name: Humpback Whale
description: Its scientific name, Megaptera, means, ~large-winged~ referring to its long, white, wing-like flippers that are often as long as one-third of the animal's total body length.

name: Humpback Whale
description: Its scientific name, Megaptera, means, ~large-winged~ referring to its long, white, wing-like flippers that are often as long as one-third of the animal's total body length.

name: Pacific Harbor Seal
description: Pacific harbor seals have spotted coats in a variety of shades ranging from white or silver-gray to black or dark brown. Males are slightly larger than females, but on average harbor seals reach 5 to 6 feet in length and weigh up to 300 pounds.

name: Pacific Harbor Seal
description: Pacific harbor seals have spotted coats in a variety of shades ranging from white or silver-gray to black or dark brown. Males are slightly larger than females, but on average harbor seals reach 5 to 6 feet in length and weigh up to 300 pounds.

name: Polar Bear
description: These marine mammals are the largest carnivores on land. When they do spend time together (in what's called a sleuth), male bears will play-fight with each other, wrestling and swatting at each other without doing any real harm.

name: Polar Bear

name: Southern Sea Otter
description: Behind its cute face and fluffy fur, the sea otter is an aquatic environmentalist. By munching on urchins, it helps kelp forests flourish, and by crunching on crabs, it promotes eelgrass in estuaries.
